intro: Tutcheria multisepala, commonly known as the multiseeded tutcheria, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tutcheria multisepala is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
